results.title: For all the world's children
results.creator_credit: William K McClure, Alfred Butterfield, UNICEF and Warner-Pathe News
results.brief_description: Portrays the world-wide activities of the United Naitons International Children’s Emergency Fund (UNICEF). Shows all phases of UNICEF’s operations, from the shipment of supplies to child feeding in Europe and the Middle East. Includes sequences on malaria control and anti-tuberculosis vaccination in India. Narrated by Dwight Weist.

results.title: For all practical purposes. Computer science. 5
results.creator_credit: Joseph Blatt, Chedd-Angier Productions and COMAP
results.brief_description: Moving picture show Computers can be used to produce a remarkable range of graphics and this program looks at how these graphics are produced. Pixels are the fundamental unit of computer images, and nothing can be drawn smaller than a pixel, which means that lines can be jagged rather than smooth. We look at anti-aliasing techniques which solve this and algorithms which solve the problems of limited time and memory. We then look at three programs from Symbolics Inc. - “Geometry” which creates 3D objects, “Dynamics” which moves them and “Render” which makes them realistic. Demonstrated techniques include splining, translation, scaling, rotation, texture mapping and opacity.

results.title: Footprint of the Buddha
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this episode Ronald Eyre visits a buddhist monastery in Sri Lanka to discover the meaning of buddhism. He finds that buddhism has no god; buddhists regard gods as useful but not crucial. The three basic principles of buddhism are to shun all evils, to do good, and to achieve purification of the mind. The individual can expect no external help, but must follow the noble eight-fold path to nirvana, using meditation to penetrate appearances and show the world as it is. The program includes the initiation of a young boy as a monk.

results.title: Footnotes to a war
results.creator_credit: Simone Di Bagno and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: By focusing on three refugees from Southeast Asia - a former soldier turned medic, a child, and a young woman - this film highlights some of the problems of resettlement and ensuing loss of cultural identity. Narrated by Lu Yu. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Football: the sport of millions
results.brief_description: Football (soccer) is a peoples sport in the German Republic. Each weekend some 1.5 million spectators attend the games, and there are over 700,000 players in the 64,000 teams. 500,000 of these are juveniles playing in junior teams being trained in special training courses and schools.

results.title: Football
results.brief_description: Football (soccer) is a major sport and social phenomenon in Britain, where the game was born. Amateur players are the backbone of the sport, about half a million of them in England alone, mostly young and many belonging to England’s 30,000 amateur clubs. The film explains the history, the competition leading up to the Cup Final and how football is now a world sport including the Chinese, Nigerians and Argentinians who come and play well-known teams in Britain.
